p: 1-Octen-3-ol, an alcohol with “mushroom-like” odor [ 19, 20], was found to be the major component (34.4%) in fresh black morel ( M. importuna). It was also found to be the major compound in freeze-dried black morel (68.61%). But, a sharp decrease of 1-octen-3-ol was found in the oven-dried sample (6.76%), which was associated with the loss of “mushroom-like” smell, and freeze-drying was proved to be more suitable for retaining morel smell.
